title: Lycanthropy
data:
**Lycanthropy** is an [intrinsic](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic") property that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

Lycanthropy is conveyed through being bitten by a [werecreature](/wiki/Werecreature "Werecreature") – a werejackal, wererat, or werewolf – as well as eating their [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"). Wielding [Werebane](/wiki/Werebane "Werebane") prevents lycanthropy from being transferred via bites. Being given lycanthropy from an attack abuses your [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution"), and eating a werecreature corpse is considered [cannibalism](/wiki/Cannibalism "Cannibalism") if you are [human](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

  - [1.1 Silver-hating](#Silver-hating)
  - [1.2 Animal abilities](#Animal_abilities)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

  - [2.1 Prevention](#Prevention)
  - [2.2 Curing and mitigation](#Curing_and_mitigation)
  - [2.3 Lycanthropy and pets](#Lycanthropy_and_pets)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Origin](#Origin)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)
  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)

- [7 References](#References)

## Description

Lycanthropy confers intrinsic [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") and hungerless [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration"), and also transforms you into your animal form at regular intervals: during daytime hours, you have a 1⁄80 chance each turn to change forms, and during the night you have a 1⁄60 chance each turn.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Depending on the animal form, you will shrink out of your [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor") and even break some of it, and your animal forms also have much lower [carrying capacity](/wiki/Carrying_capacity "Carrying capacity"); being killed while in animal form will return you to your normal form until the next transformation.

Werecreatures are the only monsters to have intrinsic lycanthropy - other monsters will not get lycanthropy from being bitten by a werecreature or eating one's corpse of a werecreature (though the corpse being [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") can deter a [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") from eating it).

[Quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") a potion of [holy water](/wiki/Holy_water "Holy water") will cure the lycanthropy and return you to your normal form if possible;[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) quaffing [unholy water](/wiki/Unholy_water "Unholy water") will immediately cause you to shift to your animal form. Inhaling the [vapors](/wiki/Vapor "Vapor") of either potion will shift you to your normal form or animal form, respectively. [Polymorphing](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") with lycanthropy will toggle between both forms.

### Silver-hating

Lycanthropes are also [silver-hating](/wiki/Silver-hating "Silver-hating") creatures: if a player is given lycanthropy, they become vulnerable to damage from [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver") weapons and other objects. Additionally, they cannot handle any silver-based items in either form - any silver items being worn or wielded when the player is afflicted with lycanthropy will be forcibly dropped, with 1d10 points of damage dealt for each silver item. This check will also cause the player to "retouch" everything in their inventory, meaning that they may also take [artifact blast](/wiki/Artifact_blast "Artifact blast") damage as well if they are carrying any cross-aligned or cross-role [artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact").

### Animal abilities

As an animal, the player has much lower carrying capacity than normal and cannot wear any armor; werejackals and wererats will be forced out of their armor and drop it, while werewolves will destroy their shirt, cloak, and body armor and drop any remaining armor. Even after shedding your armor, your [encumbrance](/wiki/Encumbrance "Encumbrance") level will often be at strained or worse, and it is not uncommon to end up overloaded as a result.

While in animal form, using the #[monster](/wiki/Monster_\(command\) "Monster (command)") command will call for help by summoning a few tame monsters of the same species as the player to your side (e.g., using #monster as a werejackal will call [jackals](/wiki/Jackal "Jackal"), [coyotes](/wiki/Coyote "Coyote") and [foxes](/wiki/Fox "Fox")). Calling for help this way requires 10 [power](/wiki/Power "Power") and exercises [Wisdom](/wiki/Wisdom "Wisdom") when used successfully.

## Strategy

Between the many setbacks of animal forms, the loss of armor with each transformation and the debilitating weakness to silver, lycanthropy is generally considered undesirable. The property does also have two notable benefits, however: drain resistance and regeneration, which are conferred alongside lycanthropy, and the ability to summon tame monsters.

### Prevention

Naturally, one of the easiest ways to deal with lycanthropy is to avoid catching it in the first place: A [ring of protection from shape changers](/wiki/Ring_of_protection_from_shape_changers "Ring of protection from shape changers") will lock werecreatures in their humanoid form, ensuring they cannot bite you. Wielding Werebane will also prevent their bites from infecting you and can make short work of hostile werecreatures itself.

In lieu of reliable protection, high [magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation") (e.g. from a [cloak of protection](/wiki/Cloak_of_protection "Cloak of protection")) can significantly reduce the chances of infection. Another good prevention method is to kill werecreatures before they can reach melee range - more often than not, many characters will find a suitable [projectile](/wiki/Projectile "Projectile") weapon or attack [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand") before they encounter one. Silver weapons are typically quite rare, but can deal enough damage to dispatch a werecreature quickly even if you lack skill in that weapon. [Pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet") are also a valuable resource in keeping a werecreature off your back, especially if you can get them between you and the hostile monster.

### Curing and mitigation

Even if you cannot reliably prevent a lycanthropy infection, there are various means to manage or even cure the condition. An [amulet of unchanging](/wiki/Amulet_of_unchanging "Amulet of unchanging") or [ring of polymorph control](/wiki/Ring_of_polymorph_control "Ring of polymorph control") can prevent unwanted transformations as long as you are conscious and not [stunned](/wiki/Stun "Stun"), [asleep](/wiki/Asleep "Asleep"), or [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused")[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) - the tradeoff for this is an inability to pick up or use any silver objects until you can cure the lycanthropy, as well as taking up a [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") or [amulet](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet") slot for that duration.

The following methods can cure lycanthropy:

- [Eating](/wiki/Eat "Eat") a [sprig of wolfsbane](/wiki/Sprig_of_wolfsbane "Sprig of wolfsbane").[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)
- Quaffing a potion of holy water.
- [Praying](/wiki/Pray "Pray") to your [god](/wiki/God "God") successfully, as lycanthropy is considered a major trouble.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

If all else fails, you can force yourself to transform back from animal form by dropping your HP to zero, e.g. [kicking](/wiki/Kick "Kick") a wall repeatedly, then gradually make your way forward until you can wait out any prayer timeout or else find a means of stopping or curing the transformations. Letting monsters kill you in animal forms is possible but tricky, due to lycanthropy giving intrinsic regeneration. Unfortunately, you will also have to consider leaving behind much if not all of your current inventory, in order to avoid being immobilized by its weight if another shift occurs.

### Lycanthropy and pets

The monsters summoned using the #monster command are generated [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") and act as normal [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet"). This can be used to acquire a very large number of jackals, [rats](/wiki/Rat "Rat"), or [wolves](/wiki/Wolves "Wolves"), which you can use as temporary meat shields at bare minimum - pets that survive can then be polymorphed (usually via [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand") or [polymorph trap](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap")) into much better pets. Very low-level characters will have trouble using this command early on, as the animal form will have much lower maximum power, and repeated "deaths" in animal form will usually result in even lower maximum power the next time you shift into animal form.

## History

Lycanthropy first appears alongside werecreatures in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

The full-inventory "retouch" from being given lycanthropy was introduced in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0").

## Origin

The word "[lycanthrope](http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/lycanthrope "wikt:lycanthrope")" (from ancient Greek λύκος \[*lýkos*, "wolf"], άνθρωπος \[*ánthropos*, "man"]) simply means "werewolf". In *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, which *NetHack* heavily borrows from, the term is extended to apply to all shape-shifting were-creatures.

## Messages

- You feel feverish.

  You were given lycanthropy from a werecreature's bite.

- You can't handle your [foo](/wiki/Foo "Foo")!

  The player was wielding a silver weapon or wearing a silver item at the time they were given lycanthropy, and is forced to drop it.

- You lack the energy to send forth a call for help!

  You tried to use the #monster command while shifted to your animal form, but do not have enough power.

- You feel purified.

  You successfully cured yourself of lycanthropy.

## Variants

### [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM")

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds several new werecreatures (and thus more potential sources of lycanthropy). A blessed [potion of amnesia](/wiki/Potion_of_amnesia "Potion of amnesia") can cure lycanthropy.

The [lycanthrope](/wiki/Lycanthrope_\(starting_race\) "Lycanthrope (starting race)") is a new starting race in SLASH'EM that always begins with the lycanthropy intrinsic; they will always be werewolves, although they will automatically remove their armor before transforming rather than destroy it (unless it is cursed).

In addition, the [doppelganger](/wiki/Doppelganger "Doppelganger") race gains intrinsic polymorph control by reaching level 9, allowing them to mitigate the side effects of lycanthropy in a manner similar to wearing the ring.

Lycanthropy

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Lycanthropy is an intrinsic property that appears in NetHack.

Lycanthropy is conveyed through being bitten by a werecreature – a werejackal, wererat, or werewolf – as well as eating their corpses. Wielding Werebane prevents lycanthropy from being transferred via bites. Being given lycanthropy from an attack abuses your constitution, and eating a werecreature corpse is considered cannibalism if you are human.

Inhaling the vapors of either potion will shift you to your normal form or animal form, respectively. Polymorphing with lycanthropy will toggle between both forms.
